40#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
41# include "config.h"
42#endif
43
44#include <sys/cdefs.h>
45__RCSID("$NetBSD: pam_get_item.c,v 1.3 2017/05/06 19:50:09 christos Exp $");
46
47#include <sys/param.h>
48
49#include <security/pam_appl.h>
50
51#include "openpam_impl.h"
52
53/*
54 * XSSO 4.2.1
55 * XSSO 6 page 46
56 *
57 * Get PAM information
58 */
59
60int
61pam_get_item(const pam_handle_t *pamh,
62 int item_type,
63 const void **item)
64{
65
66 ENTERI(item_type);
67 switch (item_type) {
68 case PAM_SERVICE:
69 case PAM_USER:
70 case PAM_AUTHTOK:
71 case PAM_OLDAUTHTOK:
72 case PAM_TTY:
73 case PAM_RHOST:
74 case PAM_RUSER:
75 case PAM_CONV:
76 case PAM_USER_PROMPT:
77 case PAM_REPOSITORY:
78 case PAM_AUTHTOK_PROMPT:
79 case PAM_OLDAUTHTOK_PROMPT:
80 case PAM_HOST:
81 case PAM_SOCKADDR:
82 case PAM_NUSER:
83 *item = pamh->item[item_type];
84 RETURNC(PAM_SUCCESS);
85 default:
86 RETURNC(PAM_BAD_ITEM);
87 }
88}
89
90/*
91 * Error codes:
92 *
93 * PAM_BAD_ITEM
94 */
95
96/**
97 * The =pam_get_item function stores a pointer to the item specified by
98 * the =item_type argument in the location pointed to by the =item
99 * argument.
100 * The item is retrieved from the PAM context specified by the =pamh
101 * argument.
102 * If =pam_get_item fails, the =item argument is untouched.
103 *
104 * The following item types are recognized:
105 *
106 * =PAM_SERVICE:
107 * The name of the requesting service.
108 * =PAM_USER:
109 * The name of the user the application is trying to
110 * authenticate.
111 * =PAM_TTY:
112 * The name of the current terminal.
113 * =PAM_RHOST:
114 * The name of the applicant's host.
115 * =PAM_CONV:
116 * A =struct pam_conv describing the current conversation
117 * function.
118 * =PAM_AUTHTOK:
119 * The current authentication token.
120 * =PAM_OLDAUTHTOK:
121 * The expired authentication token.
122 * =PAM_RUSER:
123 * The name of the applicant.
124 * =PAM_USER_PROMPT:
125 * The prompt to use when asking the applicant for a user
126 * name to authenticate as.
127 * =PAM_AUTHTOK_PROMPT:
128 * The prompt to use when asking the applicant for an
129 * authentication token.
130 * =PAM_OLDAUTHTOK_PROMPT:
131 * The prompt to use when asking the applicant for an
132 * expired authentication token prior to changing it.
133 * =PAM_HOST:
134 * The name of the host the application runs on.
135 * =PAM_SOCKADDR:
136 * The sockaddr_storage of the applicants's host.
137 * =PAM_NUSER:
138 * The "nested" user if this is a login on top of a previous one.
139 *
140 * See =pam_start for a description of =struct pam_conv.
141 *
142 * >pam_set_item
143 */
144
